citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The attending veterinarian did not visit the facility in the last year (2024). The program of veterinary care states that
regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian will be completed annually, however, a veterinary visit has not occurred
since June 28, 2023.
It's important to follow the program of veterinary care and have regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian to ensure
that the animals are receiving proper medical care, and that the veterinarian is familiar with the animals and facility in
order to provide appropriate veterinary guidance.
The licensee must follow their program of veterinary care including regularly scheduled veterinary visits to the premises.
Correct by: September 17, 2025.

The licensee has not been maintaining records of the current number of guinea pigs at the facility. The last records for the
numbers of adults, weanlings, and births were written in January 2025.
Failure to maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, or
disposed of can make it difficult to track regulated animal movement and identify trends in animal losses which could
indicate disease conditions in the guinea pigs.
The licensee must maintain records which disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, sold or disposed
of.
Correct by: September 1, 2025.
This inspection was completed with a facility representative, and the exit interview was conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The attending veterinarian did not visit the facility in the last year (2024). The program of veterinary care states that 
regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian will be completed annually, however, a veterinary visit has not occurred 
since June 28, 2023. 
It's important to follow the program of veterinary care and have regularly scheduled visits by the veterinarian to ensure 
that the animals are receiving proper medical care, and that the veterinarian is familiar with the animals and facility in 
order to provide appropriate veterinary guidance. 
The licensee must follow their program of veterinary care including regularly scheduled veterinary visits to the premises. 
Correct by: September 17, 2025. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee has not been maintaining records of the current number of guinea pigs at the facility. The last records for the 
numbers of adults, weanlings, and births were written in January 2025.  
Failure to maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, or 
disposed of can make it difficult to track regulated animal movement and identify trends in animal losses which could 
indicate disease conditions in the guinea pigs. 
The licensee must maintain records which disclose the number of animals born, held, owned, acquired, sold or disposed 
of. 
Correct by: September 1, 2025. 
 
This inspection was completed with a facility representative, and the exit interview was conducted with the licensee.
